subjects.subject_name: Department of Veterans and Military Affairs

general_provisions: This bill makes changes to the code addressing military affairs.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends resident student status eligibility for veterans who use veteran benefits to pay for tuition;<hr><ltbullet>amends how much money the Interstate Commission on Educational Opportunity for Military Children may assess, levy, or collect from Utah legislative appropriations;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs:<hr><ltbullet1>is required to provide service benefits to service members, veterans, and the families of service members and veterans; and<hr><ltbullet1>serves as the State Approving Agency for Utah under United States Code, Title 38, Veterans Benefits;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs to receive gifts, contributions, and donations to support service members, veterans, and the families of service members and veterans;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs to enter into an intergovernmental support agreement with a military installation or entity, including the National Guard, to provide support services to the military installation or entity;<hr><ltbullet>repeals Title 63M, Chapter 6, Military Base Easements Act, and enacts sections in Title 71A, Veterans and Military Affairs, related to easements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
last_action_owner: Waiting for Introduction in the Senate
